description: [BPFDoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1161) creates a zero byte PID file at `/var/run/haldrund.pid`. [BPFDoor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1161) uses this file to determine if it is already running on a system to ensure only one instance is executing at a time.(Citation: Sandfly BPFDoor 2022)

external_references.description: The Sandfly Security Team. (2022, May 11). BPFDoor - An Evasive Linux Backdoor Technical Analysis. Retrieved September 29, 2023.
